title: Improve documentation of 0.8.x -> 0.9.0 upgrade
body:
This should hopefully make the major changes more visible and avoid
surprises.

Assumes #477 will get merged (in other words, don't merge before it)

Since this changes formatting & release notes significantly it felt more appropriate to open a separate PR.

I'm also thinking usage.md is quite large now, maybe split it up?

title: Implement 'blockchain.scripthash.listunspent' RPC
body: Also refactor 'blockchain.scripthash.get_balance'.

title: Split CI into build and integration jobs
body:
Use debug build for build/clippy/fmt/unittests (using https://github.com/actions-rs).
Use release build for integration tests (using Docker).

title: Simplify 'blockchain.scripthash.get_balance' implementation
body: No need to use transaction cache for getting output values.

title: Add snappy to RocksDB features
body:
It would be useful to detect old DBs:
https://github.com/romanz/electrs/pull/477#discussion_r707600255

RocksDB compilation time increases 1m03s -> 1m07s (+6%).
Total electrs build time is 2m05s.

title: Use latest Bitcoin Core release (22.0) in CI
Fail if cookie is specified
body: Following https://github.com/romanz/electrs/issues/371#issuecomment-918217030

title: Downgrade librocksdb-sys to 6.11.4
body: It should allow dynamic linking on Debian 11 (https://packages.debian.org/bullseye/librocksdb-dev) and on Ubuntu 21.04 (https://packages.ubuntu.com/hirsute/librocksdb-dev).

title: Run p2p block parsing and processing concurrently
Update documentation for the upcoming 0.9 version
body: CC: @Kixunil @pantamis @craigraw @openoms @rootzoll @lukechilds @ascisco @raelschiffler @kentschubert @roshan-dias @afilini @ulzeraj @Overtorment @Stadicus

title: Move usage in README up and recommend our guide
body:
* Having usage up should make it more visible.
* Recommend people to use our guide as opposed to external guides which is kept up-to-date with the code.

title: A bunch of improvements to issue templates
body: These are mostly warnings about various things and asking additional information.

title: Limit index lookups to prevent DoS for "popular" addresses
body: Fixes #447

title: Use the same log verbosity levels as master

milestone.description: Implements p2p-based sync and several indexing optimizations, as described in https://github.com/romanz/electrs/issues/308#issuecomment-806061229.

body:
Current verbosity level of master are the ones here: https://docs.rs/stderrlog/0.5.1/src/stderrlog/lib.rs.html#377

p2p branch uses different level values for verbosity d153bfa2eb4435fbe2f70d38ece76152c0bcff66. This surprised me when testing outpoint notification in p2p branch (the trace logs fill my disk storage completely after two days of usage).

This PR restores the same old levels in p2p branch as master.

title: Update relevant versions in README to 0.8.10
Add a workaround for latest Bitcoin Core
body: See https://github.com/rust-bitcoin/rust-bitcoincore-rpc/pull/190.

title: Add server.features RPC
body: Fixes #439

title: Fix `--auth` support
body: If not specified, use `--cookie-file`.

title: Use rust-toolchain in GitHub actions
body: https://github.com/actions-rs/toolchain#the-toolchain-file

title: Set toolchain in GitHub actions to 1.41.1
body:
This should make sure to catch compatibility mistakes in commits.

I used some nicer trick in the past but at first I'd like to see if this helps at all.

title: Delete .travis.yaml
body: Travis is not used and this file is confusing.

title: p2p doc: in bitcoin.conf maxconnections should be >11, fixes #429
body: fixes #429

title: Clippy +nightl fixes
body:
Fix a bunch of lints emtited by `cargo +nightly check`. This is my first PR to this repo, so this just does a few of the more basic ones. Specifically, this PR introduces no API changes to the `electrs` library.

Please review critically and if there is anything I can do to fit into the projects style better please say so now so I can save your time on following PRs.

Thanks,
Tobin.

title: Return original JSON from getrawtransaction RPC
body: Should fix https://github.com/romanz/electrs/issues/427

title: Disable 'clippy::identity_conversion' on generated configuration module + add clippy to CI
body:
Otherwise, clippy fails with:

```
warning: identical conversion
   --> /media/roman/3TB/roman/Code/electrs/target/debug/build/electrs-56b1e395b2bcf88c/out/configure_me_config.rs:339:25
    |
339 |                 db_dir: db_dir.into(),
    |                         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: consider removing `.into()`: `db_dir`
    |
    = note: `#[warn(clippy::identity_conversion)]` on by default
    = help: for further information visit https://rust-lang.github.io/rust-clippy/master/index.html#identity_conversion

warning: identical conversion
   --> /media/roman/3TB/roman/Code/electrs/target/debug/build/electrs-56b1e395b2bcf88c/out/configure_me_config.rs:340:29
    |
340 |                 daemon_dir: daemon_dir.into(),
    |                             ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: consider removing `.into()`: `daemon_dir`
    ```

title: Inside contrib/addr.py example, add regtest and signet networks
body: Tested in both regtest and (custom) signet .

title: Add blockchain.scripthash.get_balance RPC
body: Fixes #420

title: Allow calling blockchain.scripthash.get_history without subscription
body: Fixes #419

title: Use JSONRPC error codes
body:
See https://www.jsonrpc.org/specification#error_object

Fixes #413.

title: Added json.dumps to Python example RPC examples
body: As suggested in comment https://github.com/romanz/electrs/pull/415#issuecomment-870345086 , `json.dumps` is added in-place of a manual construction of a request message into the Python example RPC examples

title: Add python example in RPC examples
body: Current `usage.md` contains only one example in `RPC examples` which uses `echo` and `netcat`. The PR adds new and corresponding example in `Python` which can speed up the initial use of the `electrs` for people who try to use the project for the first time.

title: Add initial support for JSON-RPC batching
body: Following #230 - please note that this PR is based over `p2p` branch (as described [here](https://github.com/romanz/electrs/issues/308#issuecomment-806061229)).

title: Updated tiny_http
body:
The previous version of `tiny_http` had a vulnerability that's probably
not relevant to `electrs` but better not risk it. It also avoids ugly
red error from `cargo audit`. :)

title: Updated sha2
body:
The new version of sha2 replaces its dependency `cpuid-bool` with
`cpufeatures` because it was renamed and the previous one is
unmaintained.

title: Use more detailed error codes
body:
Reply to malformed json-rpc requests with json-rpc responses containing a spec-compliant error code. For electrum-protocol-specific errors reply with an error code of 1 (`BAD_REQUEST`) or 2 (`DAEMON_ERROR`) depending on whether the error originated from the daemon or not.

**Edit:** This builds on the changes in #390, which was a fix for #313

title: Improve Dockerfile
body:
1. Reduces docker image size from ~860MB to ~470MB.

Running a bare `chown` (or any other form of file modification, e.g. `chmod`) recursively on a directory tree in a Dockerfile comes with a cost: docker makes a copy of the whole layer to apply the change. Solvable with [`--chown`](https://github.com/moby/moby/pull/34263) argument to `COPY`.

Changes from:
```
$ docker image ls | grep electrs                                                             
electrs-app [...] 865MB                                                          

$ docker history electrs-app                                                                 
IMAGE          CREATED         CREATED BY                                      SIZE      COMM
...
fae691841c1a   3 minutes ago   /bin/sh -c groupadd -r user     && adduser -…   393MB
1c4b0ea96c3c   3 minutes ago   /bin/sh -c #(nop) COPY dir:7956596a8fde73ca1…   393MB 
```
to:
```
$ docker image ls | grep electrs                                                 
electrs-app [...] 472MB                                                          

$ docker history electrs-app                                                                 
IMAGE          CREATED              CREATED BY                                      SIZE
...
7626a2efbb63   About a minute ago   /bin/sh -c #(nop) COPY --chown=user:userdir:…   393MB
bfbfc289f1a8   About a minute ago   /bin/sh -c groupadd -r user     && adduser -…   328kB    
```


2. This commit is only a slight improvement in that docker build caches will not get invalidated by e.g. changing `Dockerfile` or `LICENSE`, as they shouldn't be, as they don't affect the build/compilation.

Possibly the same could be done for other directories, like `doc`, `internal`, but I'm not familiar enough with the code to be confident to make that change. Ideally, the `COPY . .` statement in the Dockerfile should be rewritten to only copy the necessary minimum to get the build done correctly.


3. I assume that the only build artifact needed for the final image is the `electrs` executable, dropping these:
```
root@e84f0882e5fb:/build/target/release# du -sb *
114651560       build
278254888       deps
522     electrs.d
2       examples
2       incremental
504     libelectrs.d
```
This further reduces the docker image size to **88.8MB**

I haven't done much testing on the functionality though. All I can say is that it starts:
```
$ docker run electrs-app -v -v
Config { log: StdErrLog { verbosity: Info, quiet: false, show_level: true, timestamp: Off, modules: [], writer: "stderr", color_choice: Never }, network_type: Bitcoin, db_path: "./db/mainnet", daemon_dir: "/home/user/.bitcoin", blocks_dir: "/home/user/.bitcoin/blocks", daemon_rpc_addr: V4(127.0.0.1:8332), electrum_rpc_addr: V4(127.0.0.1:50001), monitoring_addr: V4(127.0.0.1:4224), jsonrpc_import: false, index_batch_size: 10, bulk_index_threads: 16, tx_cache_size: 10485760, txid_limit: 100, server_banner: "Welcome to electrs 0.8.9 (Electrum Rust Server)!", blocktxids_cache_size: 10485760 }
WARN - failed to connect daemon at 127.0.0.1:8332: Connection refused (os error 111)
WARN - failed to connect daemon at 127.0.0.1:8332: Connection refused (os error 111)
```

title: Fix Dockerfile, add another example
body: With my last PR #387 I messed up with filesystem permissions and health check. This is going to fix that. Besides this I removed the parameters from entrypoint, so they can be set via env variables. Also removed obsolete lines from Dockerfile and added another example for running the image.

title: Optimize Dockerfile
body:
This adds an Entrypoint to the Dockerfile and fixes #322.

It also introduces multistage Docker build, that reduces the image size from ~1.85GB to ~463MB, because the rust toolchain is no longer in the resulting image.

title: Bumped default wait_duration_secs from 5 to 10
body:
According to @craigraw this should help with performance issues while a
more complicated improvement is being developed.

See #382

title: Ignore individual mempool transaction fetch fails
body: I wrote this in the github editor, so no promises that it compiles, but this should avoid several extra heap allocations and moves while fetching the mempool, and, more importantly, get electrs out of an infinite loop of fetching the full mempool forever when there exist RBF transactions.

title: Fixed inverted logic of deprecation
body:
The warning was supposed to be shown when `cookie` is specified not the
other way around.

I have no clue how this slipped through, sorry. :(

title: Don't use batched RPCs and reduce the default `index_batch_size` to 10
body:
Use non-batched RPCs, to lower bitcoind RAM usage.

Following https://github.com/romanz/electrs/issues/373.

title: Added in-depth explanation of cookie deprecation
body:
This adds more informtion about cookie deprecation, especially
motivation, so the users won't be frustrated because of unexplained
change. It also removes a warning that's no longer applicable.

title: Fix verbose parameter in config example
body: Helps with #352

title: Implemented auth option and deprecated cookie
body:
This adds `auth` option and deprecates `cookie` which has a confusing
name. It's effectively renaming but we pretend it is not to avoid people
blindly changing the name without second thought.

Closes #349 (a new tracking issue will be created)

This is WIP because I intend to update the doc too but not before #359 is merged.

title: Improve doc
body:
This improves documentation of configuration based on @BTCBellyButton
suggestions in #344. It contains a few more tweaks.

I have also added a few more line breaks to make editing easier (separate commit to simplify review).

title: Updated several dependencies
body:
* `arc_swap` and `smallvec` fix security vulnerabilities
* `configure_me` and `configure_me_codegen` update toml dependency
  leading to deduplication and shorter compile times
* `log` upgrades dependency on `cfg-if` bringing us closer to
  deduplicating it.

Closes #354

I intend to update more things in separate PR(s). This one should be low-hanging, safe and important stuff.
I will try to hurry up so that we can release a new version if those vulnerabilities actually affect `electrs` (didn't check yet).
